Package pl.put.poznan.sorting.logic

Class SortingMadness

java.lang.Object
pl.put.poznan.sorting.logic.SortingMadness
public class SortingMadness extends Object
SortingMadness class provides functionality for sorting arrays using various algorithms. It supports sorting both integers and strings, and provides the option to reverse the order.

  • Constructor Details

    • SortingMadness

      public SortingMadness(String[] usedAlgorithms)
      Constructs a new SortingMadness instance.
      Parameters:
      usedAlgorithms - an array of algorithm names to be used for sorting

  • Method Details

    • sort

      public List<Result> sort(int[] toSort, int iterations, String order, long timeLimit)
      Sorts the given int array using the specified algorithms and configurations.
      Parameters:
      toSort - the int array to be sorted
      iterations - the number of iterations to use in the sorting algorithm
      order - the desired order of the result ("asc" for ascending, "desc" for descending)
      timeLimit - the maximum time allowed (in nanoseconds) for the sorting process
      Returns:
      a list of Result objects containing the sorted arrays, execution times, and the names of the algorithms used
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown algorithm name is provided

    • sort

      public List<Result> sort(String[] toSort, int iterations, String order, long timeLimit)
      Sorts the given String array using the specified algorithms and configurations.
      Parameters:
      toSort - the String array to be sorted
      iterations - the number of iterations to use in the sorting algorithm
      order - the desired order of the result ("asc" for ascending, "desc" for descending)
      timeLimit - the maximum time allowed (in nanoseconds) for the sorting process
      Returns:
      a list of Result objects containing the sorted arrays, execution times, and the names of the algorithms used
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if an unknown algorithm name is provided
